schema.name: mAdminState
schema.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
schema.label: Enable administrative state
schema.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
schema.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

schema.name: PolicyType

value.summary: Validate this policy and all matching policies before accepting
value.name: pre-requisite
value.description: All matching profiles in the Application Security Policy are run. A failure of any of these profiles results in the failure of the transaction. Only when all matching profiles are successful will the transaction be accepted. A typical use of this style would be a broad match that enforces a basic item, such as maximum size, that is followed up with more specific matches with stronger criteria.

value.summary: Validate this policy only before accepting
value.name: admission
value.description: Only this policy is run. If successful, the transaction is accepted.

schema.description: Select the satisfaction policy for the profile. The default value is Admission.
Select how the client side of the inspected transaction handles SSL. The default value is Allow.
schema.name: SSLPolicy

schema.description: If this property references a AAA policy, then that AAA policy will be run as a filter on this transaction and the success of that AAA run will be required to continue processing. Any input to this transaction as XML, application/www-url-encoded, or multipart/form-data MIME types will be automatically provided to the AAA processing policy.
schema.name: AAA

schema.description: Select the Shared Secret Key for both signing or encrypting.
schema.summary: Shared Secret Key used for Value or Cookie protection
schema.name: SSKey

schema.description: A rate limiting policy restricts identities (as determined by AAA or the client IP address if AAA is not available) to a specific number of transactions per second.
schema.name: RateLimiter

schema.description: This Access Control List will be used to allow or deny access to this service based on the IP address of the client. When attached to a service, an Access Control List (ACL) denies all access by default. To deny access to only selected addresses, first grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0) and then create deny entries for the desired hosts.
schema.name: ACL
OKMethods
schema.description: Specify which HTTP methods are acceptable from the client acceptable.

schema.name: OKVersions
schema.description: Specify which HTTP versions are acceptable from the client.

schema.name: MinBodySize
schema.description: Specify the minimum size of the request body.

schema.name: MaxBodySize
schema.description: Specify the maximum size of the request body.

schema.name: XMLPolicy

type.summary: Specify the processing of XML content

value.summary: Ensure that the XML message is well formed
value.name: xml
value.description: Ensures that the XML message is well formed and runs the transform rule that is specified by the XML processing rule.

value.summary: Ensure that the SOAP message is well formed
value.name: soap
value.description: Ensures that the SOAP message is well formed and runs the transform rule that is specified by the XML processing rule.

type.name: dmWebAppXMLPolicy

schema.description: Specify how the device handles requests that contain an XML MIME type.

schema.name: XMLRule
schema.summary: Assign an additional processing rule for xml
schema.description: This is the transformation rule that is run when the request contains an XML MIME type and the XML processing policy is set to XML or SOAP.

schema.name: NonXMLPolicy

type.summary: Specify the processing of non-XML content

value.summary: Run a processing rule that cannot change message content
value.name: side
value.description: Runs the specified non-XML processing rule. The rule cannot change the contents of the message. The rule cannot access the INPUT or OUTPUT context. The rule can perform such actions as authenticate and authorize, or can send a copy of the contents of the message to a third destination.

value.summary: Run the processing rule and submit the payload as unparsed binary
value.name: binary
value.description: Runs the specified non-XML processing rule. The message payload is submitted as an unparsed binary object. The rule can change the contents of the message. The rule can perform such actions as authentication and authorize, can convert to XML, can repackage with additional information, or can send a copy of the contents of the message to a third destination. The results of the rule is used as the payload for further processing.

type.name: dmWebAppNonXMLPolicy

schema.description: Specify how the device handles requests that do not contain an XML MIME type.

schema.name: NonXMLRule
schema.summary: Assign an additional processing rule for non-xml
schema.description: This is the transformation rule that is run when the request does not contain an XML MIME type and the Non-XML processing policy is set to binary or side-effect.
If this request policy is violated the firewall error policy will be invoked unless this more specific error policy is provided, in which case this policy takes precedence.
schema.name: ErrorPolicy

schema.description: The session management policy enforces the start pages acceptable for requests that match this security profile. If no policy is referenced, any page is an acceptable start page.
schema.name: SessionManagementProfile

schema.description: The name-value profile allows you to specify what headers are expected, what headers should be stripped, and what headers should be mapped to known values. If no profile is specified, any header is allowed.
schema.summary: The name-value profile for request headers
schema.name: HeaderGNVC

schema.description: The name-value profile allows you to specify what form elements are expected, what form elements should be stripped, and what form elements should be mapped to known values. If no profile is specified, any set of pairs is allowed.
schema.summary: The name-value profile for application/www-url-encoded body members
schema.name: UrlEncodedGNVC

schema.description: Select how the client URL handles query strings. The default is Allow.
schema.name: QueryStringPolicy
QueryStringGNVC
schema.summary: The name-value profile for query string
schema.description: The name-value profile for query-string. If not present, no profile is enforced. The profile allows you to validate data members of the query string, filter out unknown ones, or map certain names to known values.

schema.name: SQLInjection
schema.summary: SQL Injection Filter on all data parameters
schema.description: Data parameters from the query string, application/www-urlencoded requests, and multipart/form-data requests will be passed through the standard SQL Injection filter if this property is enabled.
The URI may be no longer than the value specified here.
schema.name: MaxURISize
URIFilterUnicode
schema.summary: Filter Requests with Unicode in the URI
schema.description: If Unicode is detected in the URI and this property is enabled then the transaction will be rejected

schema.name: URIFilterDotDot
schema.summary: Filter Requests with .. in the URI
schema.description: Filter Requests with .. in the URI after URI normalization

schema.name: URIFilterExe
schema.summary: Filter Requests with .exe in the URI
schema.description: Filter Requests with .exe in the URI after URI normalization

schema.name: URIFilterFragment
schema.summary: Policy for how to Handle Requests with # in the URI

value.summary: Reject the transaction and raise an error
value.name: reject

schema.description: Select how to handle URI fragments in requests. A URI fragment is the portion of a URI after the # symbol. The default is Truncate

schema.name: ContentTypes
schema.description: A list of PCRE regular expressions that indicate acceptable content-type MIME headers on the request. If this list is empty, any content-type is acceptable. If the request does not have a content type that will be represented as an empty string for matching purposes. Requests without a body (GET, HEAD, and so forth) are not subject to this constraint. An empty list will match all content types.

property.name: MaxParts
property.description: Maximum number of parts allowed. Defaults to 4.
Maximum size allowed for any one part. Defaults to 5000000.
property.name: MaxSizePerPart

property.description: Maximum size allowed for all parts combined. Defaults to 5000000.
property.display: Maximum Aggregate Size of All Parts
property.name: MaxSize
ContentTypeRestricted
property.description: If set, this forces the individual form-data content types to be matched against the general list of request acceptable content-type expressions.

schema.description: The cookie management profile allows you to specify validation profiles for incoming cookies, whether cookies should be allowed at all, and the signature and encryption policies for cookies.

property.name: CookiePolicy
property.description: Select how the client side of the inspected transaction handles cookies. The default value is Allow.

property.name: Type
property.description: Specify whether the device signs/verifies, encrypts/decrypts, or neither on the cookies for the application. The default value is None.

Signing or encrypting cookies requires a secret passphrase for the cryptographic operation. If this key is the same on multiple devices, then each device can statelessly verify or decrypt a cookie generated by another device.
property.name: Key

property.description: Normally the signed or encrypted cookie contains the client IP address and this prevents the client from using this cookie from any other host. Some proxy server environments may make this undesirable. Turning this property off will make the generated cookies address independent.
property.name: IPinWatermark

property.description: The name-value profile for cookie contents. If not present, no profile is enforced. The profile allows you to validate data members of the cookie, filter out unknown ones, or map certain names to known values.
property.summary: Name-value validation profile for cookie contents
property.name: CookieGNVC
UseSharedSecretObject
property.summary: Signing or encrypting cookies using the shared secret
property.description: A shared secret signs or encrypts the cookie when enabled. The default value is disabled.

schema.name: CookieProfile
ProcessAllCookie
schema.description: The process will sign or encrypt all cookies when enabled. The default is enabled.

schema.name: CookieNameVector
schema.summary: List of the cookies, by name, to process
schema.description: The list of cookies, by name, that the process signs and encrypts.

schema.name: SQLInjectionPatternsFile
schema.description: The patterns file that the SQL injection filter uses.
